project: PDF Element Overlay - Scientific Article Transformation

objectives_completed.objective: 1. Create a template like template/document.tex.xml using xml/ENDEND10921.xml and src/engine.js

details.result: Successfully created template matching sample.tex style with CSS selectors compatible with Peggy parser

objectives_completed.objective: 2. Generate a TeX file that looks like TeX/sample.tex from the created template
3. Create a PDF with element coordinates from the TeX file

technical_accomplishments: ✅ CSS selector syntax debugging for Peggy parser compatibility
✅ Scientific article template creation matching sample.tex style
✅ LaTeX compilation with proper two-column layout
✅ JSON-formatted coordinate data for UI integration

workflow_summary.step_3: Fixed CSS selector syntax issues for Peggy parser
workflow_summary.step_4: Successfully transformed XML to TeX using src/engine.js
workflow_summary.step_5: Created simplified, compilable version of TeX document
workflow_summary.step_6: Compiled TeX to PDF using pdflatex
workflow_summary.step_7: Extracted element coordinates from PDF using PyMuPDF
workflow_summary.step_8: Generated both detailed and semantic coordinate datasets

detailed_coordinates.description: Complete text structure with blocks, lines, spans

integration_ready.ui_integration: Coordinate data ready for overlay system
integration_ready.usage: Load PDF and coordinates in UI for interactive element overlay
